snippet: A lawsuit against Consolidated Edison by the Trump SoHo Hotel claims it lost business  during Hurricane Sandy because of the utility company’s negligence.
abstract: Owners of Trump SoHo, New York City hotel, file lawsuit against their insurance company Affiliated FM and Consolidated Edison, claiming that hotel lost $2.3 million during power outage following Hurricane Sandy; Affiliated FM originally denied the company's claim on business interruption policy because flood, which policy does not cover, at Con Ed subway station caused power failure; hotel charges that explosion actually caused outage.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit against Consolidated Edison by the Trump SoHo Hotel claims it lost business  during Hurricane Sandy because of the utility company’s negligence.

headline.seo: Trump SoHo Hotel Sues Con Edison for Hurricane Sandy Losses
headline.main: Hotel Blames an Explosion, Not Flooding, for Its Losses
headline.print_headline: Hotel Blames An Explosion, Not Flooding, For Its Losses
